issues.description: The problem statement explicitly instructs students to create a constructor that "initializes every attribute" and to "pay attention to the order of the attributes in the constructor, and make sure it follows the same order from the UML diagram" (lectureName, numberOfInscribedStudents, numberOfGuestStudents, numberOfLecturers, numberOfTutors). The reference solution's constructor uses a different parameter order (lectureName, numberOfLecturers, numberOfTutors, numberOfInscribedStudents, numberOfGuestStudents). This discrepancy between the specification (problem + UML) and the solution will confuse students about the expected parameter order and may cause failures in automated checks or when students compare against the reference implementation.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the constructor parameter order in the solution (and/or template example) with the UML and problem statement. Change the solution constructor signature to: public Lecture(String lectureName, int numberOfInscribedStudents, int numberOfGuestStudents, int numberOfLecturers, int numberOfTutors) and ensure the assignments inside the constructor match this order. Alternatively, if a different parameter order is intended, update the problem statement and UML to explicitly show that order so all artifacts are consistent.
